subject: Nutrition
title: Cooking and Vitamin Loss
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Cooking and Vitamin Loss.

hook.text: Boiling broccoli for ten minutes destroys up to 50% of its vitamin C. Steaming keeps most of it.

buildup.text: Heat, water, and light all break down vitamins. Water-soluble vitamins are especially vulnerable.

discovery.text: Steaming and microwaving preserve more vitamins than boiling because less water washes them away.

twist.text: Some nutrients actually increase with cooking. Tomatoes release more lycopene when heated.

climax.text: The best strategy is to vary methodsâ€”eat some foods raw, steam others, and roast the rest.

punchline.text: How you cook changes what your food delivers.

quiz.question: Which cooking method preserves the most vitamins?
